definitions.definition: Money paid for the freeing of a hostage .
examples: They were held for two million dollars ransom .

definitions.definition: The release of a captive, or of captured property, by payment of a consideration.
A sum paid for the pardon of some great offence and the discharge of the offender; also, a fine paid in lieu of corporal punishment.

main_definition: Money paid for the freeing of a hostage .
secondary_definitions: The release of a captive, or of captured property, by payment of a consideration.
( historical , law , UK ) A sum paid for the pardon of some great offence and the discharge of the offender; also, a fine paid in lieu of corporal punishment.
